name: clmzss
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cclm), wss(cz, c1), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ CMod, ℤ ⊆ c1, c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wss(cz, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)), wss(cz, c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → ℤ ⊆ c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))
⊣ (c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)→ ℤ ⊆ c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wss(cz, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)), wss(cz, c1))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → ℤ ⊆ c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))
⊣ (c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)→ ℤ ⊆ c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))
⊣ c2 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wss(cz, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)), wss(cz, c1))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → ℤ ⊆ c1)
⊣ (c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)→ ℤ ⊆ c1)
⊣ c2 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wss(cz, c1))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → ℤ ⊆ c1)
⊣ c2 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)

comment: The scalar ring of a subcomplex module contains the integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
